subject: Travel
title: The Eiffel Tower
description: Learn The Eiffel Tower in one minute.

hook.text: When the Eiffel Tower was built in 1889, Parisians hated it. They called it an iron eyesore.

buildup.text: Gustave Eiffel designed it as a temporary exhibit for the World's Fair. It was meant to be dismantled.

discovery.text: The tower used 18,000 iron pieces and 2.5 million rivets. It took just two years to build.

twist.text: It survived because it became useful as a radio transmission tower, saving it from demolition.

climax.text: Today it's the most visited paid monument on Earth, drawing 7 million visitors a year.

punchline.text: Paris's biggest eyesore became its greatest icon.

quiz.question: Why wasn't the Eiffel Tower demolished as planned?
options: It became useful as a radio tower
